answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Recurrent or chronic fever is seen in typhoid, tuberculosis, hepatitis, SLE, rheumatoid arthritis, Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) and other auto immune disorders, UTI, drug fever, sinusitis, glandular fever, otitis media, IBS, HIV, STDs, endocarditis, parasitic infestations (like malaria), fungal infections, lymphomas and other cancers etc. It can even be diabetes and hyperthyroidism.In women, even polycystic ovary, menopause, PID (pelvic inflammatory disease) should be investigated for.With repeated infection, I am sure your diabetes status has been checked. Other than that it could be due to persistent infection. If you have been to tropical kind of climate, then malaria, schistosomiasis, Brucellosis and other worms in stool should also be ruled out. Kidney infection, genital tuberculosis, inflammatory bowel disease etc are some other causes that should be looked into. Dehydration is another cause of low grade fever so increase your fluid intake and see if it helps.Hope this helps. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined for causes not looked into. Take care!

question: Hi I'm a 27 year old female and about 2 years ago out of no where i started to get swollen lymph nodes on one side of the neck and high fever for 3 days every 4 weeks between may and oct.  I've seen many doctors and many tests and most came back normal, just elevated Sed Rate.  Then from Nov 09 - May 10 i was perfectly fine.  May it started again but this time it came less frequently and fever was not as high but lasted about 5 days.  Went away again in Oct - March of this year.  Now its every 8 weeks or so and fever is about 99.2.  But then this summer i also started getting random low grade fevers reocccuring every so often.  This whole summer has been miserable.  I went to a number of docs this time around as well and did full work up and everything was nromal including sed rate.  Doctors said it's viral but i dont believe it.  Can someone please help identifiying what it is.  Just to mention when the low grade fever comes it has no other symptoms and is about 99.1 - 99.4.  thank you
title: Complex diagnosis - Unexplained low grade fever
